instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
hi, i have again new board dead. no water damage

Led green, change to orange, but no fan spin. too I check IC U7501, U7100 I can't see corrosion

some voltages:

PPDCIN_G3H 16.5 V
PP3V42_G3H 3.4 V
PPBUS_G3H 0 V
PP3V3_S5 3,3 V
PP5V_S4RS3 0 V
PP3V3_SUS 0 V
PP1V2_S3 0 V
PP1V8_S3 0V
PP1V05_S0 0V
PPVCC_S0_CPU 0V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0 V

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H 0 V
PP3V3_S5 3,3 V"
How is this possible???
Please, post accurate information.

Post U7100 basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message: flip board and I check again 0v but I have broken F7140

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
U7100

Pin1 = 0v
Pin2 = 16v
Pin3 = 4,3
Pin9 = 0v
Pin12 = 3,3v
Pin13 = 3,3v
Pin14 = 3,3v
Pin15 = 0v
Pin17 = 8,5v
Pin19 = 5v
Pin20 = 5v
Pin27 = 16v

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
So you have correct PPBUS_G3H.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS now?

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
3V3_S5= 0,52v
3V3_SUS= 0v

remember I don't have continuity in F7140

thanks friend !

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message: i fix fuse and now I have short in C7372

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
Sorry, I was thinking you've replaced the fuse.
Once C7372 is removed, check if fuse is still good.
